subsection.name: Overview
subsection.p: APT stands for "Almost Plain Text". It is a wiki-like format that allows you to write simple, structured documents with minimal formatting markup. APT was designed to be easy to read in its source format.
The APT format is supported both as source (parser) and destination (sink).

subsection.name: Limitations
subsection.p: Due to the nature of APT and the Sink API abstractions, the following limitations apply to the APT sink (output generation):
APT supports section title levels 1 through 5. If a deeper nesting level (greater than 5) is requested via the Sink API, the APT sink will replace it with level 5 and emit a warning.
